intro: Epilobium gesneri, commonly known as the purple willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium gesneri is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist habitats such as wet meadows and riverbanks. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 1 meter tall, with a preference for well-drained, loamy soils.
